title: Ephesians Chapter 5 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Ephesians chapter 5 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Ephesians Chapter 5 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Ephesians Chapter 5.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 5:2, how did Christ show love to us?
options: He gave himself for us as an offering and a sacrifice to God
He gave us wealth and power
questions.correctAnswer: He gave himself for us as an offering and a sacrifice to God
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:2 states that Christ loved us and gave himself for us as an offering and a sacrifice to God for a sweetsmelling savour.

questions.question: In Ephesians 5:3, which of the following is NOT to be named among the saints?
questions.correctAnswer: Generosity
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:3 instructs that fornication, uncleanness, or covetousness should not be named among the saints, but generosity is not mentioned negatively.

questions.question: What does Ephesians 5:4 say should be given instead of filthiness, foolish talking, or jesting?
questions.correctAnswer: Giving of thanks
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:4 says that rather than filthiness or foolish talking, one should give thanks.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 5:5, who has no inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and God?
options: Whoremonger, unclean person, covetous man who is an idolater
questions.correctAnswer: Whoremonger, unclean person, covetous man who is an idolater
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:5 states that no whoremonger, unclean person, or covetous man who is an idolater has any inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and God.

questions.question: True or False: Ephesians 5:8 says that believers were once darkness but now are light in the Lord.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:8 clearly states that believers were sometimes darkness but now are light in the Lord.

questions.question: What is the fruit of the Spirit mentioned in Ephesians 5:9?
questions.correctAnswer: Goodness, righteousness, and truth
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:9 states that the fruit of the Spirit is in all goodness, righteousness, and truth.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 5:11, what should believers do with the unfruitful works of darkness?
options: Have no fellowship with them and reprove them
questions.correctAnswer: Have no fellowship with them and reprove them
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:11 instructs believers to have no fellowship with unfruitful works of darkness but to rather reprove them.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Ephesians 5:15: 'See then that ye walk ________, not as fools, but as wise,'
questions.correctAnswer: circumspectly
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:15 advises believers to walk circumspectly, meaning carefully and wisely, not as fools.

questions.question: What does Ephesians 5:18 advise believers NOT to be drunk with?
questions.correctAnswer: Wine
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:18 instructs believers not to be drunk with wine, which causes excess.

questions.question: True or False: Ephesians 5:21 calls for submitting yourselves one to another in the fear of God.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:21 explicitly states to submit yourselves one to another in the fear of God.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 5:22, to whom should wives submit themselves?
options: Their own husbands, as unto the Lord
questions.correctAnswer: Their own husbands, as unto the Lord
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:22 instructs wives to submit themselves to their own husbands as unto the Lord.

questions.question: What example is given in Ephesians 5:25 for how husbands should love their wives?
options: As Christ loved the church and gave himself for it
As their own parents loved them
As a king loves his kingdom
questions.correctAnswer: As Christ loved the church and gave himself for it
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:25 commands husbands to love their wives even as Christ also loved the church and gave himself for it.

questions.question: True or False: Ephesians 5:31 says a man shall be joined to his wife and they shall be one flesh.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:31 states that a man shall leave his parents and be joined to his wife, and the two shall be one flesh.

questions.question: What is described as a great mystery in Ephesians 5:32?
options: The relationship between Christ and the church
questions.correctAnswer: The relationship between Christ and the church
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:32 calls the union of Christ and the church a great mystery.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 5:33, what should the wife do in relation to her husband?
questions.correctAnswer: Reverence her husband
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:33 instructs the wife to reverence her husband.

medium.title: Ephesians Chapter 5 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Ephesians Chapter 5 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Ephesians 5 teach us to respond to temptation involving immoral behavior?
options: Avoid naming or participating in such practices because they are not fitting for saints
Engage in discussions about it openly to understand it better
Ignore it because it is a personal matter
Accept it as part of human weakness
questions.correctAnswer: Avoid naming or participating in such practices because they are not fitting for saints
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:3 instructs believers to let fornication and all uncleanness or covetousness not even be named among them, as becometh saints. This shows that believers should avoid involvement and even mention of immoral behavior. Verses 5:5-7 reinforce this by warning of no inheritance in God's kingdom for such behaviors and urging believers not to be partakers with them.

questions.question: What attitude should believers have when dealing with foolish talk and jesting, according to Ephesians 5?
options: Avoid such talk and instead focus on giving thanks
Engage freely as it lightens the spirit
Use humor to gain favor with others
questions.correctAnswer: Avoid such talk and instead focus on giving thanks
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:4 teaches that filthiness, foolish talking, and jesting are not convenient for believers; instead, they should be giving thanks. This highlights a focus on gratitude rather than inappropriate speech. This is supported by the call to walk in love and light in verses 5:2 and 5:8.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 5, why should believers be cautious about the words they listen to?
options: Because vain words can deceive and bring God's wrath
Because all words are equally important
Because words do not affect spiritual life
questions.correctAnswer: Because vain words can deceive and bring God's wrath
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:6 warns believers not to be deceived with vain words since these lead to God's wrath on the disobedient. This teaches the importance of discernment in speech and influences spiritual obedience and holiness (5:7).

questions.question: How does Ephesians 5 describe the transformation in a believer’s spiritual state?
options: From darkness to light, walking as children of light
From light to darkness, embracing sin
questions.correctAnswer: From darkness to light, walking as children of light
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:8 states that believers were once darkness but now are light in the Lord and should walk as children of light. This transformation calls for a lifestyle reflecting goodness, righteousness, and truth as shown in verses 5:9-10.

questions.question: What practical advice does Ephesians 5 give to believers about their daily conduct?
options: Walk circumspectly, not as fools but as wise, redeeming the time
Live carelessly because days are hard
questions.correctAnswer: Walk circumspectly, not as fools but as wise, redeeming the time
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:15-16 instructs believers to walk carefully and wisely, making the best use of time because the days are evil. This emphasizes practical wisdom and stewardship of time in daily life.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 5, how should a believer be filled instead of being drunk with wine?
questions.correctAnswer: Be filled with the Spirit
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:18 contrasts being drunk with wine with being filled with the Spirit. This teaches that spiritual fullness and guidance come from the Holy Spirit rather than from excess alcohol or worldly indulgence.

questions.question: What activities does Ephesians 5 suggest believers should engage in when filled with the Spirit?
options: Speaking in psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs, singing and making melody in the heart to the Lord
questions.correctAnswer: Speaking in psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs, singing and making melody in the heart to the Lord
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:19 encourages believers filled with the Spirit to speak to themselves in psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs, singing and making melody in their hearts to the Lord. This shows worship and joyful expression as a spiritual discipline.

questions.question: How does Ephesians 5 instruct believers to express gratitude in their Christian walk?
options: Giving thanks always for all things unto God in the name of Jesus Christ
Only giving thanks during church services
Expressing thanks only when good things happen
questions.correctAnswer: Giving thanks always for all things unto God in the name of Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:20 teaches that believers should always give thanks for all things to God the Father in the name of our Lord Jesus Christ. This encourages continual gratitude as an important spiritual practice.

questions.question: What does Ephesians 5 say about relationships within the Christian community?
options: Submitting to one another in the fear of God
Avoiding relationships to focus on God
questions.correctAnswer: Submitting to one another in the fear of God
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:21 calls believers to submit to one another out of reverence for Christ. This promotes humility, mutual respect, and unity in the Christian community.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 5, how should wives relate to their husbands?
options: Submit to their husbands as to the Lord
Lead without regard to the husband
Treat marriage as a partnership of equals without submission
questions.correctAnswer: Submit to their husbands as to the Lord
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:22 instructs wives to submit to their own husbands as to the Lord. This submission reflects the church's relationship to Christ and is part of a biblical pattern for marriage.

questions.question: How are husbands commanded to love their wives in Ephesians 5?
options: Love their wives even as Christ loved the church and gave Himself for it
Love their wives only when convenient
Love their wives to gain favor
Love their wives as equals without sacrifice
questions.correctAnswer: Love their wives even as Christ loved the church and gave Himself for it
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:25 commands husbands to love their wives sacrificially, just as Christ loved the church and gave Himself up for her. This sets a high standard of selfless love and care in marriage.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Christ sanctifying and cleansing the church according to Ephesians 5?
options: To present it as a glorious church, holy and without blemish
To prepare it for earthly power
To make it wealthy and influential
To separate it from all other churches
questions.correctAnswer: To present it as a glorious church, holy and without blemish
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:26-27 explains Christ’s purpose in sanctifying and cleansing the church is to present it to Himself as glorious, holy, and unblemished. This illustrates the spiritual care and purity Christ desires for the church.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'So ought men to love their wives as their own ____. He that loveth his wife loveth himself.'
questions.correctAnswer: bodies
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:28 states that men should love their wives as their own bodies, emphasizing the unity and care within marriage. Loving one’s wife is equated with loving oneself.

questions.question: True or False: Ephesians 5 teaches that believers have no inheritance in the kingdom of Christ if they practice covetousness and idolatry.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:5 clearly states that no covetous man, who is an idolater, has any inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and God, emphasizing the seriousness of these sins.

questions.question: True or False: According to Ephesians 5, believers should reprove the works of darkness and not have fellowship with them.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:11 instructs believers to have no fellowship with the unfruitful works of darkness but rather to reprove them, showing the call to active spiritual discernment and correction.

hard.title: Ephesians Chapter 5 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Ephesians Chapter 5.

questions.question: What is the primary exhortation given to believers in Ephesians 5:1?
options: Be ye therefore followers of God, as dear children
Love one another as Christ loved us
Walk in the Spirit and not fulfill the lusts of the flesh
Submit yourselves one to another in the fear of God
questions.correctAnswer: Be ye therefore followers of God, as dear children
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:1 commands believers to imitate God as beloved children, establishing the foundational call to holy living.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 5:2, what is the nature of Christ's love that believers are called to walk in?
options: Christ loved us and gave himself as a sacrifice to God for a sweetsmelling savour
Christ loved us by obeying the Law perfectly
Christ loved us by teaching righteousness
Christ loved us through miracles and signs
questions.correctAnswer: Christ loved us and gave himself as a sacrifice to God for a sweetsmelling savour
questions.explanation: Verse 2 highlights Christ’s self-giving love as an offering and sacrifice to God, setting the model for believers' walk in love.

questions.question: Which behaviors are explicitly forbidden to be named among believers as stated in Ephesians 5:3?
questions.correctAnswer: Fornication, all uncleanness, and covetousness
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:3 forbids naming fornication, uncleanness, or covetousness among saints, reflecting a call to holiness.

questions.question: Ephesians 5:5 warns that certain individuals 'have no inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God.' Which of the following is NOT listed among those individuals?
options: Covetous man who is an idolater
questions.correctAnswer: Those who speak in tongues
questions.explanation: Verse 5 lists unclean persons, whoremongers, and covetous idolaters as excluded from inheritance, but does not mention speaking in tongues.

questions.question: What is the consequence mentioned in Ephesians 5:6 for those who indulge in disobedient behaviors?
options: The wrath of God comes upon the children of disobedience
They will be cast into outer darkness
They will be publicly rebuked by the church
questions.correctAnswer: The wrath of God comes upon the children of disobedience
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:6 clearly states that God's wrath comes upon those who live in disobedience, warning believers against deception.

questions.question: Ephesians 5:8 uses a metaphor contrasting the believer’s past and present state. What is this metaphor?
questions.correctAnswer: From darkness to light
questions.explanation: Verse 8 metaphorically describes believers as previously in darkness but now as children of light in the Lord.

questions.question: The phrase 'fruit of the Spirit' in Ephesians 5:9 includes which three qualities?
questions.correctAnswer: Goodness, righteousness, and truth
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:9 specifies the fruit of the Spirit as goodness, righteousness, and truth, emphasizing moral and ethical excellence.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 5:11, how should believers respond to the unfruitful works of darkness?
options: Have no fellowship with them but rather reprove them
Join them to transform from within
questions.correctAnswer: Have no fellowship with them but rather reprove them
questions.explanation: Verse 11 instructs believers to avoid fellowship with darkness and to actively reprove such works.

questions.question: Ephesians 5:14 contains an exhortation that is a direct allusion to which Old Testament concept?
options: Awake from sleep and arise from the dead, so Christ will give you light
Remember the Sabbath day to keep it holy
The call to be a holy nation, set apart
The prophecy of the new covenant
questions.correctAnswer: Awake from sleep and arise from the dead, so Christ will give you light
questions.explanation: Verse 14 alludes to Isaiah 60:1 and other prophetic calls to spiritual awakening and enlightenment through Christ.

questions.question: What dual command in Ephesians 5:15-16 reflects the cultural urgency of the time regarding moral behavior?
options: Walk circumspectly as wise, redeeming the time because the days are evil
Pray without ceasing and fast often
questions.correctAnswer: Walk circumspectly as wise, redeeming the time because the days are evil
questions.explanation: Verses 15-16 urge believers to live wisely and make the most of time, aware of the evil surrounding them in a hostile cultural context.

questions.question: Ephesians 5:18 contrasts being drunk with wine to being filled with what?
questions.correctAnswer: The Spirit
questions.explanation: Verse 18 contrasts physical intoxication with spiritual fullness, emphasizing the Spirit's role in guiding Christian conduct.

questions.question: What mutual attitude is commanded in Ephesians 5:21 that sets the tone for the following household instructions?
options: Submitting yourselves one to another in the fear of God
questions.correctAnswer: Submitting yourselves one to another in the fear of God
questions.explanation: Verse 21 establishes mutual submission as foundational for Christian relationships, including marriage.

questions.question: In the household code of Ephesians 5, how is the husband's role described in relation to the wife in verse 23?
options: The husband is the head of the wife, as Christ is the head of the church
The husband is the servant of the wife
The husband and wife are equals in all things
The husband is the provider only
questions.correctAnswer: The husband is the head of the wife, as Christ is the head of the church
questions.explanation: Verse 23 draws a parallel between Christ’s headship over the church and the husband’s headship over the wife.

questions.question: Ephesians 5:25 uses a typological connection between the husband's love for his wife and what biblical figure's love?
questions.correctAnswer: Christ’s love for the church
questions.explanation: Verse 25 typologically links the husband’s sacrificial love to Christ’s redemptive love for the church.

questions.question: True or False: According to Ephesians 5:28-29, loving one's wife is compared to loving and cherishing one's own body.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verses 28-29 explicitly state that a man who loves his wife loves himself, nourishing and cherishing her as his own flesh.

theological.title: Ephesians Chapter 5 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Ephesians Chapter 5 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 5, what is the primary characteristic believers are called to imitate?
options: Followers of God as dear children
questions.correctAnswer: Followers of God as dear children
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:1 calls believers to be followers of God as dear children, emphasizing imitation of God's character, consistent with 1 John 3:1 and 1 Corinthians 11:1.

questions.question: What kind of love does Paul instruct believers to walk in, according to Ephesians 5?
options: Love as friends love each other
questions.correctAnswer: Love as Christ loved us
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:2 teaches believers to walk in love as Christ loved us, who gave Himself as a sacrifice, aligning with John 15:13 and Romans 5:8 showing the sacrificial nature of Christ's love.

questions.question: Which behaviors are explicitly forbidden from being named among the saints in Ephesians 5?
questions.correctAnswer: Fornication, uncleanness, covetousness, filthiness
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:3-4 forbids fornication, uncleanness, covetousness, and filthiness, emphasizing holiness, consistent with 1 Corinthians 6:9-10 and Colossians 3:5.

questions.question: According to Ephesians 5, what inheritance is denied to the covetous man who is also an idolater?
options: Inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God
questions.correctAnswer: Inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:5 states that no covetous man who is an idolater has inheritance in the kingdom of Christ and of God, paralleling Galatians 5:19-21 and 1 Corinthians 6:9-10 on exclusion from God's kingdom.

questions.question: What does Paul warn believers to avoid being deceived by in Ephesians 5?
questions.correctAnswer: Vain words
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:6 warns against deception by vain words leading to God's wrath, consistent with 2 Timothy 3:13 and Colossians 2:8 about false teachings.

questions.question: What transformation does Paul describe that believers have undergone in Ephesians 5?
options: From darkness to light in the Lord
From death to life in the flesh
questions.correctAnswer: From darkness to light in the Lord
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:8 explains believers were once darkness but now are light in the Lord, which reflects the spiritual regeneration theme found in John 8:12 and 1 Peter 2:9.

questions.question: What is the 'fruit of the Spirit' mentioned in Ephesians 5?
questions.correctAnswer: Goodness, righteousness, and truth
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:9 identifies the fruit of the Spirit as goodness, righteousness, and truth, consistent with Galatians 5:22-23 and John 15:8 emphasizing Spirit-led life.

questions.question: What practical instruction does Paul give about how believers should live concerning time in Ephesians 5?
options: Redeeming the time because the days are evil
Saving time for rest and worship
Spending time in study and fasting
Ignoring worldly time and focusing on eternity
questions.correctAnswer: Redeeming the time because the days are evil
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:16 instructs believers to redeem the time because days are evil, encouraging wise use of time in light of spiritual warfare as in Colossians 4:5 and Psalm 90:12.

questions.question: Instead of being drunk with wine, what are believers commanded to be filled with in Ephesians 5?
questions.correctAnswer: The Spirit
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:18 contrasts drunkenness with being filled with the Spirit, emphasizing Spirit-filled living as also taught in Acts 2:4 and Galatians 5:16.

questions.question: How are believers instructed to express their worship in Ephesians 5?
options: Speaking in psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs, singing and making melody in the heart
questions.correctAnswer: Speaking in psalms, hymns, and spiritual songs, singing and making melody in the heart
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:19 describes worship through psalms, hymns, spiritual songs, and heartfelt melody, matching Colossians 3:16 and Psalm 95 on joyful praise.

questions.question: What is the basis for mutual submission among believers in Ephesians 5?
options: Submitting one to another in the fear of God
questions.correctAnswer: Submitting one to another in the fear of God
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:21 teaches mutual submission out of reverence for Christ, consistent with Philippians 2:3-4 and James 4:6 emphasizing humility.

questions.question: What analogy does Paul use to describe the relationship between husband and wife in Ephesians 5?
questions.correctAnswer: Christ and the church
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:23-32 repeatedly compares the husband-wife relationship to Christ and the church, highlighting love, headship, and sanctification as in 1 Corinthians 11:3 and Revelation 19:7-8.

questions.question: Why does Paul say a man should leave his father and mother and be joined to his wife in Ephesians 5?
options: So they two shall be one flesh
questions.correctAnswer: So they two shall be one flesh
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:31 quotes Genesis 2:24 about leaving parents and uniting with wife as one flesh, affirming the divine institution of marriage.

questions.question: What does Paul say husbands must do for their wives in Ephesians 5?
options: Love them as Christ loved the church
questions.correctAnswer: Love them as Christ loved the church
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:25 commands husbands to love their wives sacrificially, reflecting Christ's love, consistent with Colossians 3:19 and 1 Peter 3:7.

questions.question: What is the purpose of Christ's sanctifying and cleansing the church according to Ephesians 5?
options: To present it glorious, holy, and without blemish
questions.correctAnswer: To present it glorious, holy, and without blemish
questions.explanation: Ephesians 5:26-27 reveals Christ sanctifies and cleanses the church to present it glorious and holy, aligning with Hebrews 10:10 and Revelation 19:7-8 on the bride of Christ.
